profiles:
Summary Principal engineer experienced ten generation devices. Hands-on in advanced analytical instruments. Tracking record of technical papers on defect root causes for device and process development. 
 
Result oriented project management with proven achievements in analysis lab establishment and new analysis technique implementation.  
 
Inspiring team leader with effective mentoring and motivation skills. Strong drive for continuous improvement in analysis throughput via optimizing available resources. Experience Defect Analysis Professional Samsung Austin Semiconductor November 2006  – Present (8 years 10 months) Materials Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation May 2000  –  October 2006  (6 years 6 months) Defect Analysis Professional Samsung Austin Semiconductor November 2006  – Present (8 years 10 months) Defect Analysis Professional Samsung Austin Semiconductor November 2006  – Present (8 years 10 months) Materials Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation May 2000  –  October 2006  (6 years 6 months) Materials Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation May 2000  –  October 2006  (6 years 6 months) Education SJTU PhD,  Materials Science SJTU PhD,  Materials Science SJTU PhD,  Materials Science SJTU PhD,  Materials Science

Summary The primary focus of my laboratory expertise revolves around the use of a duel beam SEM/FIB microscope to fabricate specimens for TEM and Atom Probe analysis.  
 
In the last six years I have developed a firm grasp of the fundamental theory of these microscopes and I have mastered there operation applying this knowledge to a wide range of materials science applications. 
 
Logged over 6000 hours on SEM/FIB mastering the use of a Nano-Manipulator and GIS deposition to perform over 250 in-situ lift-outs. This experience spans a breadth of materials systems covering semiconducting materials, devices and thin films, novel metal/ceramic hybrids, anti-corrosion coatings and films, conventional and super alloy systems, concrete, bone, coral reef and polymers. 
 
Logged over 3000 hours on LEAP mastering sample preparation, data collection, data reconstruction and analysis applied to semiconducting materials, thin films, novel metal/ceramic hybrids, and conventional and super alloy systems. 
 
In addition to mastering the use of SEM/FIB and LEAP I successfully trained of over 20 users of SEM/FIB and over 10 users of LEAP. 
 
Interested in work related to advanced characterization and applications of duel beam microscopes and perhaps sales and support of this instrumentation. Experience Materials Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) Hillsboro, OR Research Professional, Microscopist The Center for Advanced Research and Technology May 2011  –  December 2012  (1 year 8 months) University of North Texas, Denton, TX (i) Served as a CART facilities liaison, equipment manager and assisted users in developing and carrying out characterization plans using multiple instruments in the CART facilities. 
(ii) Training of all new users and assisting in many projects related to SEM/FIB Dual Beam and LEAP systems and data analysis.  
(iii) Managing duties of undergraduate and graduate students in CART characterization needs and in the Institute for Science and Engineering Simulation (ISES) program projects. (ii) Investigation of hybrid microstructures via 3D serial sectioning SEM/FIB characterization with reconstruction and data analysis using Avizo Fire visualization software. Experience Process Integration Engineer Intel Corporation April 2015  – Present (5 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Process flow development for next-generation semiconductor technology. Senior Materials Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation June 2012  –  April 2015  (2 years 11 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Analytical support for next-generation semiconductor technology development. Graduate Research Associate Stanford-IBM Spintronic Science and Applications Center June 2006  –  June 2012  (6 years 1 month) Silicon Valley, Ca Conducted thesis work on the thin film growth, device fabrication, characterization, and mathematical modeling of vanadium oxide (V2O3) nanostructures toward better understanding the detailed nature of field effect switching in materials with highly correlated electrons. A member of the Stanford-IBM SpinAps collaboration. 
 
Further contributions to the laboratory: 
- Maintained and operated a state of the art, 30-source molecular beam epitaxy tool for the deposition of novel oxide and nitride films 
- Repaired and maintained an x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy tool 
- Developed Labview control and automation software to measure conductivity and carrier densities at cryogenic temperatures 
- Designed and constructed a heavily used magneto-optic Kerr measurement tool for high throughput MRAM and Racetrack Memory materials development

Summary A creative, organized, and communicative engineer & manager who enjoys data driven analysis and higher level organizational improvement, and plans to continue on a career path that allows growth as a leader in technology development. Summary A creative, organized, and communicative engineer & manager who enjoys data driven analysis and higher level organizational improvement, and plans to continue on a career path that allows growth as a leader in technology development. A creative, organized, and communicative engineer & manager who enjoys data driven analysis and higher level organizational improvement, and plans to continue on a career path that allows growth as a leader in technology development. Experience Senior Quality Reliability Engineer & Lab Manager Master Lock Company July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Oak Creek, WI *Develop and reinvigorate Quality Management System and Product Reliability/Validation strategies for New Product Development efforts to invigorate innovation as well as ensure timely & commercially successful product launches. Use a combination of leadership, documentation, and integration with ERP management to allow for measured improvement in First Pass Yield at launch and defective product at customer. 
*Design Master Validation Plan methodology and documentation, integrating Validation Test Plan (DOE) with newly designed Marketing & User Requirements Specification and Functional Requirements Specification. 
*Design and implement a Quality-Reliability-Test Database that leverages Enterprise Management Software (ERP) and used Good Database Practices & Taxonomy to automate & simplify Test Requests, Data Collection & Storage, and Data Analysis all while generating productivity metrics for Data Collection efforts. 
*Strengthen & develop Test and Analysis laboratory that is transitioning from passive performance data collection to full Reliability Engineering Analysis that delivers actionable data to fill Engineering, Manufacturing, and Marketing needs. This includes leading the acquisition and development of higher resolution metrologies in areas such as automated cycle testing, environmental durability testing, and high speed dimensional metrology. This also includes involvement with ASTM and other industry bodies. Metrology Quality Engineer Brunk Industries, Inc. January 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 7 months) * Develop and Implement Visual and Dimensional Inspection Techniques for new components, assemblies, and processes. Work with Component Design, Tool/Die creation, HVM metal stamping, and secondary processes in order to: 
- Ensure Inspection Plan execution throughout development and HVM product life cycle. 
- Ensure compliance to customer specification and industry standards (ISO 13485) 
- Collect dimensional and material data using Touch Probe, Vision, and Laser CMM Metrologies 
- Focus on efficient metrology systems with timely and actionable data. 
- Develop and coordinate Measurement System Analysis (MSA) procedures 
- Execute/Analyze Correlation & DOE studies as well as FAI, Validation/Qualificiation studies 
 
* Assist in Quality Engineering efforts of component development 
-Creation of Control Plans & Inspection Plans (Metrology and Sampling) 
-Failure Modes Effects Analysis (FMEA), Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) 
-Document effective work instructions, customer reports, and data management methodologies. 
 
* Role model teamwork & leadership through effective communication throughout organization. Coach, train, and mentor team of Quality Inspectors on manufacturing floor and influence peers in Design, Tool & Die Engineering, Process Engineering, and Project Management Operations Manager Intel Corporation January 2007  –  August 2011  (4 years 8 months) Portland, Oregon Area * Led growing team of technicians (from 6-16) through challenges of increased output, engineering integration, and improved efficiency, teamwork, and manufacturing quality. 
-Developed Statistical Process Control Methodologies and work with LEAN team to implement ISO9001 certified Manufacturing and Quality System processes. 
-Created weekly indicators of line quality an create incentives for quality improvement measures 
-Designed and implemented a range of products process improvements including a New Product Initiation methodology and Automated Inspection system. 
-Focused on technical writing skills of team to significantly improve documentation and created a full array of process specification for implementation in the lab and ISO9001 certification. 
-Increased output capacity of metrology lab (3x) and throughput time (2x+) by using effective management and leadership techniques alongside data analysis and engineering improvements. Experience Material Analysis Engineer Intel Corporation May 2014  – Present (1 year 4 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Postdoctoral Scholar University of Washington Chemical Engineering September 2013  –  April 2014  (8 months) Seattle, WA Research Assistant University of Washington Chemical Engineering October 2008  –  August 2013  (4 years 11 months) I worked in the National ESCA and Surface Analysis Center for Biomedical Problems (NESAC/BIO) at the University of Washington. I was a graduate student in the department of Chemical Engineering.  
 
Project: Chemical analysis of single cells and tissue sections using time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectrometry (ToF-SIMS). 
 
My primary achievements were: 
-	Characterized several protocols to prepare mammalian cells for ToF-SIMS analysis (frozen-hydrated vs. freeze-dried vs. chemically fixed). 
-	Produced accurate reconstructions of whole eukaryotic cells, intracellular structures and non-native small molecules with 3D ToF-SIMS chemical imaging (dual beam) and atomic force microscopy (AFM). 
-	Determined distinct metabolic differences in breast cancer cell lines using ToF-SIMS and multivariate analysis methods. 
-	Investigated metabolism in breast cancer by examining biopsied tissues using ToF-SIMS imaging, multivariate analysis and conventional histology.
